com.energyxxer.commodore.defpacks

Class DefinitionPack

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.energyxxer.commodore.defpacks.DefinitionPack

  • public class DefinitionPack
extends java.lang.Object
    Serves as a medium to incorporate game data from a pack, containing things from type definitions and tag definitions to custom category definitions. This definition pack can then be loaded and imported into a command module once or multiple times, copying all of the definitions supplied by the pack into that command module.

    A definition pack can be created from, but not limited to, a classpath resource, a directory in the filesystem or a zip file. More sources can be made by extending the CompoundInput interface.

    Definition packs have the following structure:
     root/
      pack.json
      data/
          namespace/
              tags/
                  category_name/
                      tag_name.json
                      tag_subfolder/
                          nested_tag.json
    Of these, pack.json is mandatory. Its root should be an object containing the main configuration for the pack.
    Accepted values currently are:

    version - int: serves to tell Commodore what version this pack is meant to be parsed as, for the sake of backwards compatibility. The current version will be in the CURRENT_PACK_VERSION field. This documentation will always cover info only for the current pack version.
    categories - object: It should be an object where each element's key corresponds to a type category, and their value corresponds to an object containing that category's properties. Possible category options are as follows:
    1. use_namespace: boolean - Describes whether the namespace of that type should be printed along with the type's name. For instance, blocks utilize the namespace (minecraft:stone), while gamemodes don't (survival). true if it should include the namespace, false if it shouldn't. If not specified, defaults to false. Types for categories that don't use namespaces will be stored in the minecraft namespace
    2. import_from: string - Specifies the path from the root of the definition pack to find all the definitions for the corresponding category. The .json extension for this file is implicit. This path doesn't need to be any of those defined in the definition pack structure above. In the standard definition pack for Minecraft Java 1.13, all the definitions are under the definitions/ folder. If not specified, no default types are created for this category.
    3. tag_directory: string - Describes the name of the folder under the data/namespace/tags/ directory where tags for this category should be exported. If not specified, tags for this category will not be exported.
    An example of an entry in the root object of pack.json is as follows: 
     {
   "version": 1,
   "categories": {
     "block": {
       "use_namespace": true,
       "import_from": "definitions/blocks",
       "tag_directory": "blocks"
     },
     "item": {
         "use_namespace": true,
         "tag_directory": "items",
         "import_from": "definitions/items"
        }
   }
 }
    For type definition files, the root should be an object, where each element's key corresponds to a type name (including namespace, if applicable), and each element's value should be an object, containing any properties the pack deems appropriate for the type. Those properties will then be added to the generated Type object's property map in a String-String pair. Non-string property values, such as numbers, booleans, objects and lists, will be stored as raw strings.

    An example of a type definition in the root object of a type definition is as follows: 
     "minecraft:speed": {
     "id": 1,
     "type": "positive"
 }
    As for the content of tag files, the format is exactly the same as vanilla Minecraft tags, with one extra property. You can add a boolean property called "export" to the root object of the file to specify whether or not that specific tag should be exported by any command module that has it, during compilation. By default, tags created by definition packs are not exported into data packs.
    See Also:
    StandardDefinitionPacks, CommandModule, CompoundInput, Type, Tag

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the definition pack's contents from the source into this object for future use.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IOException occurred during the retrieval of the pack's resources.
        MalformedPackException - If mandatory files or properties are not found in the source.

      • populate

        public void populate(CommandModule module)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Adds all this definition pack's definitions into the given module. This method loads the definition pack into memory if it hasn't already been loaded.
        Parameters:
        module - The module to populate with this pack's definitions.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IOException occurred during the retrieval of the pack's resources (and hasn't been loaded before).
        MalformedPackException - If mandatory files or properties are not found in the source (and hasn't been loaded before).

      • getBlueprints

        public java.util.Collection<DefinitionBlueprint> getBlueprints(java.lang.String category)
        Retrieves the list of blueprints for types of the specified category.
        Parameters:
        category - The category whose blueprints should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The list of blueprints for that specific category, if it exists. Otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the definition pack hasn't been loaded yet.

      • getDefinitions

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<DefinitionBlueprint>> getDefinitions()
        Retrieves the map of each type blueprint, where the key is the category and the value is the list of its type blueprints.
        Returns:
        The map of each type blueprint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the definition pack hasn't been loaded yet.
